title: Umber hulk (monster class)
data:
- *For the monster, see [Umber hulk](/wiki/Umber_hulk "Umber hulk").*

The **umber hulk** is a [monster class](/wiki/Monster_class "Monster class") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*, and is represented by the uppercase [U](/wiki/U "U") glyph (U). Umber hulks are designated internally by the macro `S_UMBER`.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

The [umber hulk](/wiki/Umber_hulk "Umber hulk") is the only member of the monster class.[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 History](#History)

- [2 Variants](#Variants)

  - [2.1 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
  - [2.2 SporkHack](#SporkHack)
  - [2.3 UnNetHack](#UnNetHack)
  - [2.4 dNetHack](#dNetHack)
  - [2.5 NetHack Fourk](#NetHack_Fourk)
  - [2.6 xNetHack](#xNetHack)
  - [2.7 SpliceHack](#SpliceHack)
  - [2.8 EvilHack](#EvilHack)
  - [2.9 SlashTHEM](#SlashTHEM)
  - [2.10 Hack'EM](#Hack.27EM)

- [3 References](#References)

## History

The umber hulk first appears in Hack for PDP-11, a variant of [Jay Fenlason's Hack](/wiki/Jay_Fenlason%27s_Hack "Jay Fenlason's Hack"), and is included in the initial bestiary for [Hack 1.0](/wiki/Hack_1.0 "Hack 1.0").

## Variants

Some variants opt to further populate the umber hulk monster class, and may even repurpose it to add existing monsters. The [biodiversity patch](/wiki/Biodiversity_patch "Biodiversity patch") contains the [umbral hulk](/wiki/Umbral_hulk "Umbral hulk") and [hunger hulk](/wiki/Hunger_hulk "Hunger hulk"), [pun](/wiki/Pun "Pun")-based variants of the umber hulk with gazes that can [blind](/wiki/Blind "Blind") you or drain your [nutrition](/wiki/Nutrition "Nutrition"), respectively; other variants may add umber hulk variants with similarly punny names and gaze attacks.

The [shambling horror](/wiki/Shambling_horror "Shambling horror"), U, is a monster with randomized stats and traits that appears in many variants, and is always a part of the umber hulk monster class or its equivalent.

### SLASH'EM

[SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM") adds one new monster to the monster class:

- U [water hulk](/wiki/Water_hulk "Water hulk")

### SporkHack

[SporkHack](/wiki/SporkHack "SporkHack") is the first variant to include the shambling horror in the monster class.

### UnNetHack

[UnNetHack](/wiki/UnNetHack "UnNetHack") also adds the shambling horror to the monster class.

### dNetHack

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack") (and [notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack")), this monster class is replaced by the [unknown abomination](/wiki/Unknown_abomination "Unknown abomination"), which uses the same glyph and includes the umber hulk as part of the monster class - unknown abominations are still designated internally by the macro `S_UMBER`.

### NetHack Fourk

In [NetHack Fourk](/wiki/NetHack_Fourk "NetHack Fourk"), this monster class is phased out in favor of the [large deep-rock dweller](/wiki/Large_deep-rock_dweller "Large deep-rock dweller"), X, which the umber hulk is part of - the U glyph is repurposed for the [ursine](/index.php?title=Ursine\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Ursine (page does not exist)") monster class.

### xNetHack

In [xNetHack](/wiki/XNetHack "XNetHack"), this monster class is replaced by the [aberration](/wiki/Aberration "Aberration"), which uses the same glyph and includes the umber hulk as part of the monster class.

### SpliceHack

[SpliceHack](/wiki/SpliceHack "SpliceHack") and [SpliceHack-Rewrite](/wiki/SpliceHack-Rewrite "SpliceHack-Rewrite") add some monsters to the monster class:

- U [umbral hulk](/wiki/Umbral_hulk "Umbral hulk")
- U [hunger hulk](/wiki/Hunger_hulk "Hunger hulk")
- U [slumber hulk](/index.php?title=Slumber_hulk\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Slumber hulk (page does not exist)")
- U [shambling horror](/wiki/Shambling_horror "Shambling horror")

### EvilHack

[EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack") adds the shambling horror to the monster class.

### SlashTHEM

[SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM") retains the water hulk from SLASH'EM and adds two other monsters to the monster class from the biodiversity patch:

- U [umbral hulk](/wiki/Umbral_hulk "Umbral hulk")
- U [hunger hulk](/wiki/Hunger_hulk "Hunger hulk")

SlashTHEM also adds the [terror hall](/index.php?title=Terror_hall\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Terror hall (page does not exist)") [special room](/index.php?title=Special_room_\(SlashTHEM\)\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Special room (SlashTHEM) (page does not exist)"), which is populated by various hulks.

### Hack'EM

[Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM") adds some monsters to the monster class, which are all imported from other variants:

- U [umbral hulk](/wiki/Umbral_hulk "Umbral hulk")
- U [hunger hulk](/wiki/Hunger_hulk "Hunger hulk")
- U [slumber hulk](/index.php?title=Slumber_hulk\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Slumber hulk (page does not exist)")
- U [water hulk](/wiki/Water_hulk "Water hulk")
- U [shambling horror](/wiki/Shambling_horror "Shambling horror")

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [include/monsym.h in NetHack 3.6.7, line 61](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/include/monsym.h#L61)
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [src/monst.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 1834](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/monst.c#L1834)

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.](/images/f/f7/Nh367-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.")
html:
Umber hulk (monster class)

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
For the monster, see Umber hulk.

The umber hulk is a monster class that appears in NetHack, and is represented by the uppercase U glyph (U). Umber hulks are designated internally by the macro S_UMBER.[1]

The umber hulk is the only member of the monster class.[2]

Contents

  • 1 History
  • 2 Variants
    • 2.1 SLASH'EM
    • 2.2 SporkHack
    • 2.3 UnNetHack
    • 2.4 dNetHack
    • 2.5 NetHack Fourk
    • 2.6 xNetHack
    • 2.7 SpliceHack
    • 2.8 EvilHack
    • 2.9 SlashTHEM
    • 2.10 Hack'EM
  • 3 References

History

The umber hulk first appears in Hack for PDP-11, a variant of Jay Fenlason's Hack, and is included in the initial bestiary for Hack 1.0.

Variants

Some variants opt to further populate the umber hulk monster class, and may even repurpose it to add existing monsters. The biodiversity patch contains the umbral hulk and hunger hulk, pun-based variants of the umber hulk with gazes that can blind you or drain your nutrition, respectively; other variants may add umber hulk variants with similarly punny names and gaze attacks.

The shambling horror, U, is a monster with randomized stats and traits that appears in many variants, and is always a part of the umber hulk monster class or its equivalent.

SLASH'EM

SLASH'EM adds one new monster to the monster class:

  • U water hulk

SporkHack

SporkHack is the first variant to include the shambling horror in the monster class.

UnNetHack

UnNetHack also adds the shambling horror to the monster class.

dNetHack

In dNetHack (and notdNetHack), this monster class is replaced by the unknown abomination, which uses the same glyph and includes the umber hulk as part of the monster class - unknown abominations are still designated internally by the macro S_UMBER.

NetHack Fourk

In NetHack Fourk, this monster class is phased out in favor of the large deep-rock dweller, X, which the umber hulk is part of - the U glyph is repurposed for the ursine monster class.

xNetHack

In xNetHack, this monster class is replaced by the aberration, which uses the same glyph and includes the umber hulk as part of the monster class.

SpliceHack

SpliceHack and SpliceHack-Rewrite add some monsters to the monster class:

  • U umbral hulk
  • U hunger hulk
  • U slumber hulk
  • U shambling horror

EvilHack

EvilHack adds the shambling horror to the monster class.

SlashTHEM

SlashTHEM retains the water hulk from SLASH'EM and adds two other monsters to the monster class from the biodiversity patch:

  • U umbral hulk
  • U hunger hulk

SlashTHEM also adds the terror hall special room, which is populated by various hulks.

Hack'EM

Hack'EM adds some monsters to the monster class, which are all imported from other variants:

  • U umbral hulk
  • U hunger hulk
  • U slumber hulk
  • U water hulk
  • U shambling horror

References

  1. ↑ include/monsym.h in NetHack 3.6.7, line 61
  2. ↑ src/monst.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 1834

Umber hulks are designated internally by the macro '''S_UMBER'''.{{refsrc|include/monsym.h|61|version=NetHack 3.6.7}} The [[umber hulk]] is the only member of the monster class.{{refsrc|src/monst.c|1834|version=NetHack 3.6.7}} ==History== The umber hulk first appears in Hack for PDP-11, a variant of [[Jay Fenlason's Hack]], and is included in the initial bestiary for [[Hack 1.0]]. ==Variants== Some variants opt to further populate the umber hulk monster class, and may even repurpose it to add existing monsters. The [[biodiversity patch]] contains the [[umbral hulk]] and [[hunger hulk]], [[pun]]-based variants of the umber hulk with gazes that can [[blind]] you or drain your [[nutrition]], respectively; other variants may add umber hulk variants with similarly punny names and gaze attacks. The [[shambling horror]], {{brightcyan|U}}, is a monster with randomized stats and traits that appears in many variants, and is always a part of the umber hulk monster class or its equivalent. ===SLASH'EM=== [[SLASH'EM]] adds one new monster to the monster class: * {{monsymlink|water hulk}} ===SporkHack=== [[SporkHack]] is the first variant to include the shambling horror in the monster class. ===UnNetHack=== [[UnNetHack]] also adds the shambling horror to the monster class. ===dNetHack=== In [[dNetHack]] (and [[notdNetHack]]), this monster class is replaced by the [[unknown abomination]], which uses the same glyph and includes the umber hulk as part of the monster class - unknown abominations are still designated internally by the macro S_UMBER. ===NetHack Fourk=== In [[NetHack Fourk]], this monster class is phased out in favor of the [[large deep-rock dweller]], {{white|X}}, which the umber hulk is part of - the {{white|U}} glyph is repurposed for the [[ursine]] monster class. ===xNetHack=== In [[xNetHack]], this monster class is replaced by the [[aberration]], which uses the same glyph and includes the umber hulk as part of the monster class. ===SpliceHack=== [[SpliceHack]] and [[SpliceHack-Rewrite]] add some monsters to the monster class: * {{black|U}} [[umbral hulk]] * {{red|U}} [[hunger hulk]] * {{blue|U}} [[slumber hulk]] * {{brightcyan|U}} [[shambling horror]] ===EvilHack=== [[EvilHack]] adds the shambling horror to the monster class. ===SlashTHEM=== [[SlashTHEM]] retains the water hulk from SLASH'EM and adds two other monsters to the monster class from the biodiversity patch: * {{black|U}} [[umbral hulk]] * {{red|U}} [[hunger hulk]] SlashTHEM also adds the [[terror hall]] [[Special room (SlashTHEM)|special room]], which is populated by various hulks. ===Hack'EM=== [[Hack'EM]] adds some monsters to the monster class, which are all imported from other variants: * {{black|U}} [[umbral hulk]] * {{red|U}} [[hunger hulk]] * {{blue|U}} [[slumber hulk]] * {{monsymlink|water hulk}} * {{brightcyan|U}} [[shambling horror]] ==References== {{nethack-367}} [[Category:Monster classes]]
